title.narrative: LIFE SKILLS EDUCATION

description.narrative: Children aged 6-17 access timely and quality early childhood education, basic and post-basic education in humanitarian situations in Iraq, which contributes to Early Learning, Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes, Skills Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2019, children of basic and post-basic school age, especially girls, have increased and more equitable access to quality learning in a progressively strengthened education system, including in humanitarian situations

participating-org.narrative: GENERAL DIRECTORATE OF EDUCATION IN KIRKUK

mailing-address.narrative: C/o UNICEF Amman P.O. Box 1551 Amman 11821

sector.narrative: Provision of skills development for multiple age groups (including in temporary learning spaces)
System strengthening - mainstreaming of skills development within national education/training system

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Children aged 6-17 access timely and quality early childhood education, basic and post-basic education in humanitariansituations in Iraq

description.narrative: Implementation of Life Skills and Citizenship Education (LSCE) expanded especially in retaken governorates of Mosul, Al-Anbar, and Kirkuk where more teachers were trained and children conducted or participated in non-classroom curricular activities and community outreaches. In Kurdistan region the MOE completed integration of life skills within the basic education curriculum. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:01/08/2018
